page.title: 05OLIVERS
page.content:
There has been a house on this site since the reign of Henry III (1216_1272). The name of the house comes from a family named Oliver who lived in the reign of Edward I.
The Manor passed through several hands and was owned by the Eldred family in the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries.The Eldreds were merchants. In 1720 John Eldred married Susanna Rawstorn of Lexden Manor.David Papillon,a well_known name in Colchester,came to Olivers from Lexden Manor in 1968 and lived there until his death in 1979.David Papillon was also descended from the Rawstorns.He laid out the garden in its present form.Future plans for the garden include a meadow area where wild flowers can feed themselves.The present owners are Mr & Mrs D.Edwards.
